name: The Schoolhouse Learning Center
description: This school has a dedicated Abenaki-inspired Three Sisters Garden and receives heirloom seeds from the Elnu and Nulhegan bands of the Vermont Abenaki tribe. Their "Story Time" preschool program is a State of Vermont 5-Star program

name: Arrowhead Forest Farm
address: Not explicitly listed, but operates as a forest preschool
description: This is a nature-based forest preschool that aligns with Vermont Early Education Learning Standards. While not explicitly Native American-owned, its focus on nature and community development may resonate with indigenous values

name: North Branch Nature Center - Forest Preschool
address: Not explicitly listed, but is embedded in a nature center
description: This is Vermont's first licensed Forest Preschool embedded in a nature center. It is a play-based program focused on connecting children with nature

name: Wild Strawberry Forest School
address: Not explicitly listed, but operates on a 10-acre homestead
description: This is a forest school for 2-5 year olds that acknowledges the land was first stewarded by the Sokoki tribe of the Abenaki Indigenous people. They are entirely outdoors from mid-April through October
